text: lemon bars where my mother's favorite
dessert when I was growing up she made
them for every party and we all just
loved them so I was a little hesitant to
adapt the recipe because it's kind of
sacred but what I did i think made them
even better i added olive oil to the
curd because olive oil it works really
well with the lemon and it also balances
out the sweetness and even better I
still use butter I like a lemon bar with
a really thick shortbread crust so I
make a little more than most recipes do
with some lemon zest in it I do it the
food processor because it's easier could
also use a mixer press it into an even
layer there's just nothing like hands
it's your best utensil in the kitchen
while this bakes I will make the topping
when my mother used to make lemon bars
she would never cook occurred but I
think cooking occurred gives you a silky
or texture and it's really easy you just
take the lemon juice the sugar go to put
eggs in there and just cook it for a
couple of minutes I use a combination of
whole eggs and yolks the yolks just make
it a little bit richer a little bit more
dense and then cornstarch is important
as a little bit of extra thickening I'm
going to stir it together before I put
the heat on you want to bring this up to
a boil and then we're gonna pour it on
the crust the boiling part is important
because if you don't get this hot enough
the cornstarch isn't gonna activate and
then the curd isn't going to gel
straining it just gives you the silkiest
curd if you don't do it you risks
getting a few little curdled bits of egg
better to strain butter is traditional
and occurred what's not traditional is
olive oil that's my own little touch but
I really like the flavor
I mean olive oil has such a fruity
flavor but it also has a little bit of
appealing bitterness now you always want
to add your lemon zest
after you've strained otherwise you're
just gonna strain out all the lemon zest
and what is the point of that right
and this can go straight on top of my
baked crust the crust can still be warm
that's fine and now back into the oven
so this is what happens when they chill
they get nice and firm and I'm just
gonna loosen them so that I can pull
this out notice how I left these little
bits of parchment I'm going to use them
as handles and the idea is that I pull
it out and I cut them neatly on the
cutting board let's see if it works
hmm nice if I was really neat I would
get a ruler and use that as a guide but
we're among friends for maximum effect
garnish just before serving powdered
sugar some places heavier than others
but that's all fine and then a little
bit of sea salt because I love lemon
olive oil and salt together and you know
what I think my mom would too
